qas.question: What song was sung at Chopin's funeral?
Who was the organist at Chopin's funeral?
What was played at his graveside?

answers.text: Funeral March from Chopin's Piano Sonata No. 2

qas.question: What Mozart song was sung at Chopin's funeral?
Who was the organist for Chopin's funeral?
Which cemetery was Chopin buried in?
What was played at Chopin's graveside?

answers.text: the Funeral March from Chopin's Piano Sonata No. 2

context: <a0_0><a4_0>Mozart's Requiem<a4_0/><a0_0/> was sung at the funeral; the soloists were the soprano Jeanne-Anais Castellan, the mezzo-soprano Pauline Viardot, the tenor Alexis Dupont, and the bass Luigi Lablache; Chopin's Preludes No. 4 in E minor and No. 6 in B minor were also played. The organist at the funeral was <a1_0><a5_0>Louis Lefébure-Wély<a5_0/><a1_0/>. The funeral procession to <a6_0>Père Lachaise Cemetery<a6_0/>, which included Chopin's sister Ludwika, was led by the aged <a2_0><a7_0>Prince Adam Czartoryski<a7_0/><a2_0/>. The pallbearers included Delacroix, Franchomme, and Camille Pleyel. At the graveside, <a8_0>the <a3_0>Funeral March from Chopin's Piano Sonata No. 2<a8_0/><a3_0/> was played, in Reber's instrumentation.
